definition: to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: But they, like Adam, have transgressed the covenant, there have they dealt treacherously against me.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們在阿當就違犯了盟約，在那裏已背叛了我。

sentences.english: The problem is that many violators remain, even after they are exposed .
sentences.chinese: 問題在於，很多違犯者即使被揭露了也還在那裏待着。

sentences.english: Or kings be breakers of their own behests ?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼帝王要違犯自己定出的法規？

sentences.english: They infringe the principle of non-discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 他們違犯了非歧視原則。

sentences.english: We had to kick out G4 this year for violating the rules.
sentences.chinese: 今年，我們把違犯了規定的G4趕了出去。

sentences.english: I had ever consciously entertained the idea of violating the laws of the land.
sentences.chinese: 我有意識地產生了違犯國法的想法。

sentences.english: The move is designed to avert legal action by the European Union for violating its anti-monopoly rules.
sentences.chinese: 此舉是爲了避免歐盟對其違犯反壟斷法採取法律行動。

sentences.english: I vow to adhere to the disciplinary rules promulgated by the Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 恪遵佛陀所制戒律規範，誓不違犯。

sentences.english: He skint his words once over again.
They were there contrary to the regulations. They had slipped into the garden and there they remained.
sentences.chinese: 他們違犯了規章，溜進了公園，他們就在裏面待下來。

sentences.english: Those who violingested traffic regulines should be punished.
sentences.chinese: 違犯交通規則的人應當遭到科罰。
這種違犯規則者會受到懲罰嗎？

sentences.english: Violators will be prosecuted to the maximum extent possible.
sentences.chinese: 違犯者將以最嚴厲之罰則被訴追其法律責任。

sentences.english: Exomologesis was a ritual of recognizing oneself as a sinner and a penitent.
sentences.chinese: 告解庭是一種儀式，承認自己是原罪違犯者及懺悔者。

definition: to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to be in charge of something specific
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
